To the heroic people of Hong Kong. I come from East Berlin and partizipated in the uprising that ended the communist regime here. It was a nonviolent revolution, noone was killed despite all the guns on regimes side and we all have been very surprised when the regime suddenly collapsed, we expected to get shot.
I can really understand your situation and i feel with all the victims of the horrible police brutality.

Please allow me some suggestions.

- loose fleeing crowds are easy prey for the raptors to single out protestors and beat them up, stay together and build chains, first rows hold together and shield and the rows behind can colorbomb and constructionfoam attacking raptors

- you can not outgun the police, dont try to beat and hurt the policemen, dont use petrolbombs , a burned police will give them every excuse they want, you will loose support of the people and sympathie of the west

- go for the gear, throw colorbombs at them, use oil color, use CONSTRUCTION FOAM! It will ruin their gear and blinding them, smearing their visors and shields, make their guns useless and not hurt them physically. A colorbombed or foamed policeman is out of business, he will have to retreat and change gear and ruin their cars on the way, this will make every police action extra expensive and he is out of the battle. You can reduce their numbers very effectively.
A colorbombed water cannon is blind.
